subject: Re: [junit] Using JUnit on an RMI Server
msgSnippet: ... These sound like Learning Tests for RMI. In that case, forget about your application and domain model for a second; just create a dead simple RMI
messageBody:
David Whyte wrote:
> >
> > I would suggest you mock the RMI server interface. You shouldn't
> > need to test the operation of the server itself.
> >
>
> Hmmm...yeah. I just want to check that I am sending everything across
> correctly, such as serialized objects, and no local references, that
> kind of stuff.

These sound like Learning Tests for RMI. In that case, forget about your
application and domain model for a second; just create a dead simple RMI
client/server object pair and verify you can throw objects across. These
tests should be enough to learn how to use RMI properly. The expected
results from those tests become assumptions (mock/fake server setup
code) for your other tests.

Good luck.
